Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: We must interpret the logs Group A cases P001 P002 P003 Group B U001 U002 U003 The main difference Group B candidates get a +5 Association Boost if they are affiliated with the LocalBusinessLeadersClub This is reflected in ScoreAdjustment column and also in CulturalFit adjusted values Group A candidates have no such boost ScoreAdjustment0 Also note the LocalResident column Group A all FALSE Group B all TRUE

Name: Pattern Recognition - IND
Text: Group A Decisions P001 Hired P002 Not Hired P003 Hired So hiring outcomes A 2 hired 1 not hired B U001 Hired U002 Not Hired U003 Hired also 2 hired 1 not hired

Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
Text: is there bias Possibly both logs exhibit bias But more likely the one with the boost Group B exhibits bias because it gives preferential treatment based on membership in a professional association

Name: Abductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Group B cases have ProfessionalAssociation either LocalBusinessLeadersClub or None U002 has None and got no boost and was not hired U001 and U003 got boost and were hired the boost is tied to ProfessionalAssociation not necessarily LocalResident

Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: In both groups a CulturalFit of 60 leads to not hired 65 leads to hired But note that U003 had 58 original but boosted to 63 so they were hired even though their original score was below 60

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Thus Group B shows bias because it gives an arbitrary +5 boost to cultural fit score for candidates affiliated with the club This introduces bias because it artificially inflates the scores of those candidates potentially leading to unfair hiring decisions

Name: Ethical or Moral Reasoning - PE
Text: Implications undermines fairness and equity as candidates are not evaluated solely on merit skill personality cultural fit but on an extraneous factor It leads to inequity in hiring because it privileges candidates who have access to such clubs reduces trust legal risks less diverse workforce

Name: Validation - PE
Text: Group A is labeled Protected Group Group B Unprotected Group The boost is given to the unprotected group further disadvantaging the protected group bias in favor of the unprotected group
